summary: The 'Pedestrian Hazard, Awareness, and Safety Expansion Act of 2025' addresses pedestrian safety. It mandates the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) to investigate innovative traffic control technologies. The Secretary of Transportation is tasked with a study on physical alternatives to protect pedestrians, analyzing crash data and examining safety systems. A grant program is established to fund cities, tribes, and municipalities for infrastructure improvements enhancing pedestrian safety, encompassing crosswalks, facilities, buffer zones, and more. Funding of $5,000,000 per fiscal year is authorized.
